ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Spanish speaking, reading, and writing skills, discussion of current events in Latin America, literary analysis in spanish
I gained a deeper comfort in having regular academic discussions conducted in Spanish.
Spanish language and culture!
I got much better at speaking Spanish and improved my vocabulary.
I feel like I improved my conversational Spanish skills greatly.
Spanish speaking, especially on the fly/in conversation.
I gained conversational and comprehension skills in Spanish.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: the units were very well put together, the content was interesting, our class discussions were interesting, Professor Sanchez Walker was amazing and so supportive and engaged
Weaknesses: there were a lot of group projects and not a lot of time to get them done, this often meant that one person was doing a lot more than others, felt that we could have gone over grammar and vocab a little more, the book we read at the end of the course felt really rushed
This course could have more opportunities to express personal interest/discussion in Spanish.
Great course. I love the new course structure they implemented this year, and how it focuses more on engagement and learning, instead of punitive grading.

strengths: rigorous, discussion-based, very reasonable grading, fun
weaknesses: homework every day of the week, asynchronous group work that was annoying logistically
Instructor was amazing and class was engaging. Workload was very high.
Very good at making you learn conversational Spanish skills, but at times it was easy to be silent without prompting
There are so many strengths in this course! The workload is perfect, the content is engaging, and the professor was amazing.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this class to another student and would encourage them to take the course with professor Snchez Walker. She was such a kind, supportive, and engaging professor. She made our class environment and discussion so interesting and fruitful. I feel like I really learned how to speak Spanish in conversation with others. If I'm being honest, I do feel that my knowledge of grammar regressed a little bit in this class, but the benefits of the curriculum really outweighed that.
I would recommend this to a student seeking to continue improving their Spanish-speaking skills.
Yes, especially with Sanchez-Walker. She's so sweet and incredibly supportive!
YES! As long as you have a bit of time for home work every day.
Yes, take the course with Noelia Snchez Walker!
Yes, especially with Dr. Sanchez Walker. She is amazing.
I would definitely recommend it! I have already told other students interested in Spanish to sign up for it.
